item.title: Fintech Execs from Synctera, Unit, and Treasury Prime discuss the future of BaaS at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
The serious, long-term negative impact of the bankruptcy of banking-as-a-service (BaaS) fintech Synapse will be significant “on all of fintech, especially consumer-facing services,” one observer has said. In the wake of that company’s collapse, other startups in the space are working hard to prove that not all BaaS are created equal. As partners to fintechs, […]

item.title: Google releases new ‘open’ AI models with a focus on safety
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google has released a trio of new, “open” generative AI models that it’s calling “safer,” “smaller” and “more transparent” than most — a bold claim, to be sure. They’re additions to Google’s Gemma 2 family of generative models, which debuted back in May. The new models, Gemma 2 2B, ShieldGemma and Gemma Scope, are designed […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google Maps announces new features and somehow none of them are ‘pause navigation’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Look, we’ve all been there. You’re on a road trip and you pull off the highway for some food or fuel. And then Google Maps starts (rudely) yelling at you to get back on the road. The company has all the money and AI chips in the world and yet the app can’t just chill […]

item.title: AI startups ramp up federal lobbying efforts
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
AI lobbying at the U.S. federal level is intensifying in the midst of a continued generative AI boom and an election year that could influence future AI regulation. New data from OpenSecrets, a nonprofit group that tracks and publishes metrics on campaign financing and lobbying, shows that the number of groups lobbying the federal government […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Bungie employees say they were caught off-guard by 17% staff reduction
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Bungie, the gaming company that created sci-fi hits such as Halo, Destiny, and Marathon, has laid off 220 employees, roughly a 17% reduction to its workforce, the company announced Wednesday. This is Bungie’s second round of layoffs since it was taken over by Sony in 2022. Two former Bungie employees affected by Wednesday’s layoffs say […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Copyright Office tells Congress: ‘Urgent need’ to outlaw AI-powered impersonation
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
The U.S. Copyright Office has issued the first part of a report on how AI may affect its domain, and its first recommendation out of the gate is: we need a new law right away to define and combat AI-powered impersonation. “It has become clear that the distribution of unauthorized digital replicas poses a serious […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
The tech layoff wave is still going strong in 2024. Following significant workforce reductions in 2022 and 2023, this year has already seen 60,000 job cuts across 254 companies, according to independent layoffs tracker Layoffs.fyi. Companies like Tesla, Amazon, Google, TikTok, Snap and Microsoft have conducted sizable layoffs in the first months of 2024. Smaller-sized […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. That growth has propelled OpenAI itself into […]

item.title: How to enable Apple Intelligence on your iPhone
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
If you are on the developer beta, you can only use Apple Intelligence features if your language is set to U.S. English and region is set to U.S.

item.title: This Week in AI: Companies are growing skeptical of AI’s ROI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Hiya, folks, welcome to TechCrunch’s regular AI newsletter. This week in AI, Gartner released a report suggesting that around a third of generative AI projects in the enterprise will be abandoned after the proof-of-concept phase by year-end 2025. The reasons are many — poor data quality, inadequate risk controls, escalating infrastructure costs and so on. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Over 100 VCs pledge support for Kamala Harris
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
More than 100 VCs, including Reid Hoffman, Vinod Khosla and Mark Cuban have pledged to vote for Vice President Kamala Harris in the upcoming U.S. presidential election. Mobilizing under the group VCsForKamala, the VCs are also soliciting donations for Harris’ campaign. But the organizers say the effort isn’t meant to align with any one political […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Investors pour money into non-alcoholic beverages
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Startups are attracting serious funding to provide fun, alcohol-free drink options at the bar and in other social contexts. Earlier this year, canned water company Liquid Death announced that it has raised $67 million in new funding at a $1.4 billion valuation. And Athletic Brewing Company, which describes itself as America’s largest non-alcoholic brewery, said […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Match Group cuts 6% of staff as it shuts down livestreaming in dating apps
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Match Group announced Tuesday that it has discontinued livestreaming services in its dating apps, resulting in a 6% reduction in workforce. The news was delivered during the dating app giant’s second-quarter earnings report. The move finds Match shifting its focus to other offerings, including generative AI. The decision to end livestreaming will directly impact dating apps […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Neura shows off humanoid robot 4NE-1
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
This week’s video shows 4NE-1 doing a lot; in some sense, it’s doing more than we’ve seen from other humanoids in the space.

item.title: Bending Spoons acquires file transfer service WeTransfer
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Bending Spoons said that it will continue reserving 30% of WeTransfer’s advertising space to give back campaigns and editorial content.

item.title: Tezi is building an AI agent for hiring managers
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
AI agents are all the rage right now, and Tezi, an early-stage startup, is working on one to help HR teams find the perfect candidates for a job opening. The startup claims this bot will sift through resumes to find the ones that match the hiring criteria, find time on the recruiter’s calendar to set […]

item.title: Sybill raises $11M for its AI assistant that helps salespeople reduce administrative burden
item.dc:creator: Kate Park, Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Sybill, a startup that has built an AI assistant specifically for sales reps, has raised $11 million in a Series A round led by Greycroft.

item.title: Date Like Goblins, a new dating platform, allows users to virtually date and play video games
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Date Like Goblins is geared toward the gaming community and allows users to connect through voice chat while playing video games.

item.title: Leaf helps farms decipher the troves of data they generate
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Farms produce a lot of data. From machines to irrigation systems, farms generate a lot of information that could be helpful to both them and the companies that serve them. Traditionally this data has been siloed across different formats, making it hard to read and build off of. Leaf is trying to change that. New […]

item.title: Checkly tests software by mimicking the way people use it
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Checkly helps devs get signals about an app's performance and downtime, offering a set of subscription-based synthetic monitoring tools.
